details.title: Delhi Metro: Magenta Line, Grey Line resume services after over five-and-a-half months
details.content: Services on other lines which had reopened under stage one from Monday through Thursday will now also follow the stage two schedule. Yellow Line and Rapid Metro were the first ones to be reopened on Monday, followed by Blue Line and Pink Line resuming services on Wednesday. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

With the people of Delhi-NCR efficiently following our safety guidelines, we have successfully begun operations on the magenta and grey lines today: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation pic.twitter.com/2749drCA90

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: Unprecedented surge in recoveries in India: Health Ministry
details.content:
There has been an unprecedented surge in #COVID19 recoveries in India. There is more than 100% increase in patients recovered and discharged in the past 29 days: Ministry of Health pic.twitter.com/SiNwykQdTp

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: 54 Indian brought back from China
details.content:
A flight carrying 212 Indians, few foreign & Chinese nationals landed in Ningbo, China from Delhi last night. The flight carried back 54 Indians to the motherland: Consulate General of India in Shanghai, China pic.twitter.com/2qxrvCJGi9

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: Mizoram tally
details.content:
Number of COVID-19 cases reaches 1,353 in Mizoram including 750 discharges: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/7pYkQPn8LA

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: China approves first nasal spray COVID-19 vaccine for trials from November
details.content: Microbiologist from the University of Hong Kong, Yuen Kwok-yung, said the vaccine stimulates the natural infection pathway of respiratory viruses to activate the immune response. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Over 11 lakh samples tested in last 24 hours
details.content:
A total of 5,40,97,975 samples tested up to 10th September 2020. Of these, 11,63,542 samples were tested yesterday: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) pic.twitter.com/1Rv75ir30X

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: Oxford vaccine trial stopped after volunteer developed neurological symptoms: AstraZeneca
details.content: The study participant in late-stage testing reported symptoms consistent with transverse myelitis, a rare inflammation of the spinal cord, said company spokesman Matthew Kent. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Lockdown scenes from Kolkata
details.content:
Kolkata: Streets wear a deserted look as complete lockdown is being observed in West Bengal today amid #COVID19 pandemic.

Visuals from Dhakuria crossing, Gariahat crossing and Park Circus crossing in Kolkata. pic.twitter.com/iw8b0Vi9Nt

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: After ICMR study, Centre plans to review permit for off-label use of plasma therapy
details.content: The findings of the trial carried out in 39 hospitals across 14 states and Union Territories, showed that plasma did not benefit moderately-ill Covid-19 patients either in terms of reducing mortality or progression. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Proposal to reopen schools from September 21 draws mixed reaction from states
details.content: While Delhi and Congress-ruled Punjab turned it down, southern states like Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Telangana appear to be sitting on the fence for now. According to TN school education minister K A Sengottaiyan, any decision on reopening shall be taken only after there is some relief from the pandemic. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Delhi Metro's Magenta line reopens
details.content:
Delhi: Magenta Line of the #DelhiMetro is operational from today; Visuals from Botanical Garden metro station. pic.twitter.com/4JbkBrnasd

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) September 11, 2020

details.title: Nearly 97,000 new cases in last 24 hours
details.content:
India's #COVID19 case tally crosses 45 lakh mark with a spike of 96,551 new cases & 1,209 deaths reported in the last 24 hours.

The total case tally stands at 45,62,415 including 9,43,480 active cases, 35,42,664 cured/discharged/migrated & 76,271 deaths: Ministry of Health pic.twitter.com/cAnTFUvmnq

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 gone? Bengal BJP chief thinks so
details.content:
Corona has gone. Didimoni (Mamata Banerjee) is acting and imposing lockdown so that BJP can't organise meetings and rallies in the state. No one can stop us: Dilip Ghosh, BJP President, West Bengal at a public rally in Dhaniakhali (9/9/2020) pic.twitter.com/VVSJ0mSBCg

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: Hospitals to get 80 per cent oxygen cylinders, says Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray
details.content: He also said that although there were only a handful of testing laboratories in the state when the outbreak began, their number has now grown to 550. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Lockdown in Bengal's Midnapore
details.content:
West Bengal: Shops closed and streets deserted in Midnapore as the state observes complete lockdown today, in view of #COVID19. pic.twitter.com/eARwnD86FX

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 cases in India cross 45-lakh mark, 1,209 dead in last 24 hours
details.content: The total coronavirus cases mounted to 45,62,414, while the recoveries surged to 35,42,663, the data updated at 8 am showed. The COVID-19 case fatality rate has further dropped to 1.67 per cent while the recovery rate was recorded at 77.65 per cent. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: 740 new cases in Rajasthan
details.content:
Rajasthan detects 740 new #COVID19 positive cases and 7 deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to 98,116 including 1,199 deaths, 80,490 recoveries & 16,427 active cases: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/LfeH5cAU9p

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: NEET authorities to decide if symptomatic candidates can write test
details.content: A symptomatic candidate should be referred to the nearest health centre and given an opportunity to undertake the examination through other means, or the university or educational institution shall arrange for taking the exam at a later date when the student is declared physically fit. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Deepak Chahar to train from today: CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan
details.content: Chahar has got an all-clear not just from the CSK side but also from the BCCI medical team and is ready to hit the ground running, after recovering from COVID-19. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 patient's kin manhandle doctors in Maharashtra, one held
details.content: Police have arrested a man and launched a search for at least nine others for allegedly manhandling a few doctors at a private hospital in Murbad town of Maharashtra's Thane district over a COVID-19 patient's treatment, an official said on Friday. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Continue virtual courts in post-COVID period as digital justice is faster, cheaper: Parliamentary panel
details.content: Asserting that a court is more of a service than a place, the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Personnel, Public Grievances, Law and Justice in its report said it is time that the court room, regarded as the "last bastion of antiquated working practices", opens its doors to the latest technology. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra continue to be virus hotspots in India
details.content:
Nearly 74% of the total active cases are in the nine most affected States. Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Andhra Pradesh contribute more than 48% of the total active cases: Ministry of Health pic.twitter.com/nbBlM0RA2p

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: Kerala Industries Minister EP Jayarajan tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: The minister and his wife PK Indira who also turned positive were shifted to the Government Medical College Hospital at Pariyaram on Friday. Their condition is reported to be stable. Four of his office staff have been quarantined. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: News from Assam
details.content:
In view of difficulties regarding cremation of COVID positive patients, it's decided that expenditure up to Rs 5000 will be allowed in case of death of COVID patients, towards cremation expenses, if relatives don't receive body or can't bear cremation expenses: Assam Govt pic.twitter.com/m9QwdJZXcl

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: Centre writes to states again
details.content: In a letter written to the States/UTs, Union Health Secretary has emphasised that availability of adequate and uninterrupted supply of medical oxygen is an important pre-requisite for managing moderate and severe cases of COVID-19: Ministry of Health.

details.title: 22 new cases in Himachal
details.content:
Himachal Pradesh records 22 new #COVID19 positive cases today, taking the total cases in the state to 8,512 including 2,706 active cases, 5,726 recoveries and 66 deaths: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/UNjHhHdr7d

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: 189 more Maharashtra cops infected, one dead in last 24 hours
details.content: 189 more Maharashtra police personnel tested COVID-19 positive while 1 died, in the last 24 hours. Total number of positive cases in the police force rise to 18,405 including 3,612 active cases, 14,608 recoveries & 185 deaths till date: Maharashtra Police.

details.title: Puducherry Congress Vice President K Vinayaga moorthy succumbs to coronavirus
details.content:
Puducherry Congress Vice President K Vinayaga moorthy passed away due to Covid-19 at a private hospital in Chennai today. @NewIndianXpress @xpresstn

— Debjani Dutta (@Debjani_TNIE) September 11, 2020

details.title: SC directs state to fix reasonable price for ambulance services
details.content:
Supreme Court directs states to fix reasonable prices for ambulance services to #COVID19 patients; expresses concern over inflated charges.

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: 24 doctors, 38 trainee cops test COVID-19 positive in Gujarat
details.content:
Twenty-four doctors working in hospitals run by Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) have tested coronavirus positive in the last three days,officials said on Friday. At Karai near Gandhinagar, 38 trainee policemen were also found infected, they said. "Of the 24 doctors who tested positive, four are senior doctors or faculty members of affiliated medical colleges. All others are junior doctors," AMC's deputy municipal commissioner O P Machra said.

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Metro operations will start from 6 AM on all sections on September 13: DMRC
details.content:
This Sunday, 13th September, Metro operations will start at 6 AM on all sections. Starting next Sunday, 20th September, regular timings as per earlier time table with services starting at 8 AM on Phase 3 sections (on Sundays) will continue: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) pic.twitter.com/vaCfEedY0R

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: WATCH  | When India had less than 60,000 COVID cases, actual infection was over 100 times bigger: ICMR study
Platform ticket to cost Rs 50 in key Bengaluru stations to prevent crowding in COVID-19 times
details.content: In an effort to deter the public from thronging railway stations in COVID-19 times, the Bengaluru Railway Division has effected a five-fold hike in the cost of a platform ticket at KSR (Bengaluru City), Bengaluru Cantonment and Yesvantpur railway stations. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.content:
This is very strange. In the name of COVID, they should reduce the fees, not levy more. I am going to take adequate actions against it: Karnataka Education Minister S Suresh Kumar on private schools to charge COVID fees pic.twitter.com/euuH8hvE7T

details.title: Without vaccine only prevention is taking precautions: Punjab Health Minister
details.content:
"Without a vaccine, the only prevention is taking precautions. Most #COVID19 related deaths here are caused by comorbidities & other lifestyle diseases," says Balbir Singh Sidhu, Health Minister of Punjab on being asked that the state records highest COVID mortality rate in India pic.twitter.com/O97iwnqEQQ

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: It's states' responsibility to ensure oxygen for Covid-19 patients, says Centre amid shortage
details.content: While acknowledging that there is a shortage of medical oxygen for Covid-19 patients in some states, the Centre on Friday put the onus of ensuring its availability solely on states. The directive came amid reports of acute shortage of oxygen supply in hospitals in several states including the worst-hit Maharashtra where the official tally of cases is nearing 1 million-mark. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Chandigarh reports 3 more deaths
details.content: Chandigarh reported three more COVID-19 fatalities on Friday, taking their number to 83, while 305 new cases pushed the infection tally in the Union territory to 7,292. An 83-year-old woman was among the fresh fatalities recorded on the day, a medical bulletin issued here said.

details.title: 109 fresh cases in Manipur
details.content: Manipur's tally has gone up to 7,579 after 109 people tested positive for coronavirus in the past 24 hours, an official said on Friday. The new cases included 59 from Imphal West district and 12 from Imphal East.

details.title: 27,989 cases of violating mask-wearing norms registered in Pune
details.content:
#Maharashtra: 27,989 cases of violating mask-wearing norms registered in Pune from Sep 2- 10.
"The only aim of this rule is to encourage people to wear masks in public places. The enforcement has been carried out by the PMC & the Pune Police," says B Singh, DCP Crime, Pune City. pic.twitter.com/VckAG72XPq

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: 2,172 new coronavirus cases in Mumbai
details.content: The tally of COVID-19 cases in the financial capital of the county increased to 1,65,287 with 2,172 new cases being reported on Friday, said the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). The death toll in the city reached 8,064 with 44 new fatalities, it said.

details.title: Surat cases rise by 275
details.content: The number of COVID-19 cases in Surat district in Gujarat increased by 275 in the last 24 hours to reach 23,886, while three deaths in city limits and two in the rural parts took the toll to 860, an official said on Friday.

details.title: Chennai: Private hospital sacks 15 doctors
details.content: At least 15 doctors on Covid-19 duty at a private hospital in the city were allegedly issued termination notices, and a few others contract closure notices, after they protested a management decision to cancel their quarantine leave. (READ HERE)

Battling #COVID19 with a smile? While selling plastic products in a roadside footpath in Odisha's Bhubaneswar, this woman finds respite in her child. @XpressOdisha @Siba_TNIE

details.title: Another Odisha minister tests positive
details.content: Odisha's Food Supplies and Consumer Welfare Minister Ranendra Pratap Swain Friday said he has tested positive for COVID-19.

details.title: 25 deaths in Chhattisgarh
details.content: Chhattisgarh reported 2,438 new coronavirus cases and 25 deaths on Friday, taking the statewide case tally to 58,643 and death toll to 518, a health official said. The day saw discharge of 1,138 patients from hospitals following recovery while 130 patients completed home isolation, taking the total number of recoveries to 27,123.

details.title: 174 new cases in Ahmedabad
details.content: As many as 174 new coronavirus cases emerged in Gujarat's Ahmedabad district in the last 24 hours, said a release by the state Health Department on Friday evening. With the addition of 174 cases, Ahmedabad's tally of COVID-19 cases reached 33,378.

details.title: 250 new cases in Meghalaya
details.content: Five more people died due to COVID-19 in Meghalaya, raising the death toll in the northeastern state to 24, a senior official said on Friday. At least 250 people tested positive for the disease since Thursday, which pushed the tally to 3,447, he said.

details.title: Uttarakhand tally
details.content:
Uttarakhand records 995 #COVID19 cases, taking the total tally of the state to 29,221, including 388 deaths and 19,428 recoveries: Uttarakhand State Control Room pic.twitter.com/rMhNqMlxBt

— ANI (@ANI) September 11, 2020

details.title: Pune police fine 27,989 people in 8 days
details.content: The Pune Police has fined as many as 27,989 people between September 2 and September 10 for not wearing face masks amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic and collected over Rs 1 crore as fine, informed Bachhan Singh, DCP Crime Branch, Pune.
